name: Sahara Desert
hint: The world's largest hot desert, spanning most of North Africa across 11 countries

name: Kalahari Desert
hint: A large semi-arid savanna in southern Africa covering parts of Botswana, Namibia, and South Africa

name: Congo Rainforest
hint: The world's second-largest tropical rainforest, in the Congo River Basin of Central Africa

name: Serengeti
hint: A vast ecosystem in East Africa famous for its annual migration of over a million wildebeest

name: Great Rift Valley
hint: A continuous geographic trench running from Lebanon to Mozambique, most prominent in East Africa

name: Ethiopian Highlands
hint: A rugged mass of mountains in Ethiopia, sometimes called the Roof of Africa, source of the Blue Nile

name: Namib Desert
hint: A coastal desert in southern Africa, considered the oldest desert in the world, famous for its sand dunes

name: Okavango Delta
hint: A large inland delta in Botswana where the Okavango River empties into the Kalahari, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
